metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11756 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper refcounting of soft token session objects could cause a use-after-free and crash (likely limited to a denial of service). This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
